mcq.statement: All the following facts about camels make them adapt to long periods of drought in hot deserts, except?

options.a: Camels can drink as much as 1/3 of their body weight in ten minutes, which other mammals cannot
options.b: The camel’s thick coat insulates its body against high temperatures thereby reducing water loss
options.c: Camels can survive a loss of up to 40% of their body water, for most mammals this limit is 20 percent
options.d: Camels do not sweat until the external temperature exceeds 41°C, which is much higher than for most mammals
